svdrank_test.cpp

Determines the numerical rank of a rectangular matrix "amatA", when a singular value decomposition for "amatA" has taken place before. For a singular value decomposition defined as

the resulting orthogonal matrices U and V and the singular values in W sorted by descending order are used to determine the rank of input matrix A.

Parameters:
amatA The input matrix A, with .
umatA The column-orthogonal matrix U.
vmatA The orthogonal matrix V.
wvecA n-dimensional vector containing the singular values in descending order.
Returns:
none.
Please follow the link to view the source code of the example. The example can be executed in the example directory of package LinAlg.

Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1995
Changes
none
Status
stable
See also:
svd.cpp
00001 //===========================================================================
00051 //===========================================================================
00052 
00053 #include <iostream>
00054 #include "Array/ArrayIo.h"
00055 #include "LinAlg/linalg.h"
00056 
00057 using namespace std;
00058 
00059 int main() 
00060 {
00061     Array2D< double > A(2,2);    // input matrix 
00062     Array2D< double > U(2,2);    // the two orthogonal
00063     Array2D< double > V(2,2);    // matrices
00064     Array  < double > w(2);      // vector for singular values
00065     unsigned          curr_row,  // currently considered matrix
00066                       curr_col,  // row/column
00067                       r(0);      // rank of input matrix A
00068 
00069     // Initialization values for input matrix:
00070     double input_matrix[4] = 
00071     { 
00072          1.,  3.,  
00073 
00074         -4.,  3.
00075     };
00076 
00077     // Initializing matrices and vector:
00078     for (curr_row = 0; curr_row < 2; curr_row++)
00079     {
00080         for (curr_col = 0; curr_col < 2; curr_col++)
00081         {
00082                 A(curr_row, curr_col) = input_matrix[curr_row*2+curr_col];
00083                 U(curr_row, curr_col) = 0.;
00084                 V(curr_row, curr_col) = 0.;
00085         }
00086           w(curr_row) = 0.;
00087     }
00088 
00089     // Singular value decomposition:
00090     svd(A, U, V, w);
00091 
00092     // Sorting singular values by descending order:
00093     svdsort(U, V, w);
00094 
00095     // Determining rank of matrix A:
00096     r = svdrank(A, U, V, w);
00097 
00098     // Output of matrices, singular values and rank:
00099     cout << "input matrix:" << endl;
00100     writeArray(A, cout);
00101     cout << "column-orthogonal matrix U:" << endl;
00102     writeArray(U, cout);
00103     cout << "orthogonal matrix V:" << endl;
00104     writeArray(V, cout);
00105     cout << "vector of singular values:" << endl;
00106     writeArray(w, cout);
00107     cout << "\nrank of matrix A is " << r << endl;
00108 
00109     return 0;
00110 }
